articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in Sweden
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in Sweden 
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun was inaugurated in Stockholm on March 17.
 Participants in the inaugural ceremony decided to form the preparatory committee with Christer Lundgren, acting chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, as its chairman.    
 Discussed there were matters of working out an action program for the day and making effective preparations for successful functions.

articles.title: Mexican President Supports Reunification of Korea
articles.content:
Mexican President Supports Reunification of Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Vicente Fox Quesada, president of Mexico, when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador to the country on March 16, said the Mexican government and people hoped Korea would be reunified and the Korean people would gain successes in their work to build a great prosperous powerful nation.
 He manifested thanks to the DPRK government and people for their support to the policy pursued by the Mexican government and sympathy for the Korean government and people's efforts for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: 23rd April Spring Friendship Art Festival to be Held
articles.content:
23rd April Spring Friendship Art Festival to be Held 
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The 23rd April Spring Friendship Art Festival will be held in Pyongyang on the occasion of the significant Day of the Sun.
 The festival is a grand international art festival for highly praising President Kim Il Sung as the eternal sun of progressive humankind and a significant occasion in further consolidating bonds of friendship and promoting cultural exchange and cooperation among peoples and artistes of different countries.    
 It will bring together at least 70 art and circus troupes involving well-known winners of international and national concours prizes and veteran actors and actresses of many countries of the five continents, art troupes of overseas Koreans and DPRK art troupes to present colorful stage programs as in the past.

articles.title: Serbian President Hopes for Peaceful Solution of Korean Question
articles.content:
Serbian President Hopes for Peaceful Solution of Korean Question 
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Serbian President Boris Tadic expressed support to the efforts of the DPRK for a peaceful solution of the issue of the Korean Peninsula and hope for a peaceful settlement to the Korean question when he received DPRK Ambassador Kim Ha Dong paying a farewell call on him on Mar. 16.
 The Serbian government and people are following with deep concern the efforts of the DPRK to defend the sovereignty and territory and reunify the country in a peaceful way, he stated.    
 He said he, as president, would make efforts to develop the friendly relations between Serbia and the DPRK further still.
